author: Gary Leff
title: Phish Festival Outrage: Hotels Canceling Bookings Last-Minute To Cash In, Re-Sell Rooms For More
text: Phish is performing at a massive festival in Delaware. Hotels are just canceling reservations to re-sell the rooms for more. A year ago rumors began that Phish was launching a festival in Dover, Delaware. People booked hotel rooms for August 15 – 18 in advance of 45,000 fans swarming the town. That got them regular rates on rooms. These aren’t mistake rates. They paid what a hotel normally cost. To hotels, though, it was a lost opportunity and regret. The fans knew what hotels didn’t – that these would be dates with high demand, and people would be willing to pay more. So the hotels have been cancelling on fans, and doing it at the last minute. The Wyndham Garden Dover hotel [was cancelling rooms](https://www.delawareonline.com/story/news/2024/08/14/wyndham-garden-dover-cancels-phish-fans-days-before-mondegreen/74779361007/) – that had been booked for a year- on Sunday morning, just days before the event. - Some guests received messages that they had cancelled the bookings themselves - Others were told their ‘payment’ hadn’t gone through, even for non-prepaid rooms - Still others were just told the hotel was overbooked and wouldn’t honor their reservation Complaining customers were told to write in, and the hotel ignored the messages. Some who did manage to speak to someone were told that the hotel had bookings they needed to honor for Air Force guests (that they somehow didn’t know about earlier). Meanwhile hotels were charging three times more than usual. Those bookings, apparently, were being honored. Wyndham corporate directed guests back to the hotel. People sometimes mistakenly assume they’re a customer of the chain. - Hotel owners are the customers - Guests are the product. Hotel owners sometimes refer to loyalty members as “leads” as in sales leads, or prospects to market rooms to. This is hardly unusual. Hotels cancel guest reservations when they can sell rooms for more all the time, like [during the NFL draft](https://viewfromthewing.com/booking-betrayal-hotel-tries-to-triple-its-room-rate-when-it-realizes-nfl-draft-is-happening-nearby/) or [a solar eclipse](https://viewfromthewing.com/solar-eclipse-scandal-marriott-platinums-free-night-stay-cancelled-so-hotel-can-sell-room-for-more-cash/) or [a big college graduation](https://viewfromthewing.com/what-is-a-mistake-price-really-hotel-refuses-to-honor-its-regular-rate-on-a-night-it-could-charge-more/comment-page-1/). Sometimes the hotel just [resells rooms and is honest about what they’ve done](https://viewfromthewing.com/hotel-cancels-award-stay-because-they-found-someone-better-to-rent-rooms-to/). That’s happened to me more than once (a Westin and an Alila). Here’s [how to avoid getting walked when a hotel is oversold](https://viewfromthewing.com/hotel-avoid-being-walked/).

author: Curating Team
title: How Is Cryptocurrency Impacting Traditional Investment Markets?
text:
The rise of cryptocurrency is transforming how traditional investment markets operate.
From diversification to liquidity changes, cryptocurrencies are leaving a mark on global finance. Understanding these impacts reveals the growing integration between digital assets and conventional financial systems.
Offering New Avenues for Portfolio Diversification Cryptocurrencies provide investors with a unique asset class, uncorrelated with traditional investments like stocks and bonds. This opens new diversification opportunities for portfolios.
Digital assets like Bitcoin often behave differently during economic shifts, potentially acting as a hedge against inflation or market downturns.
Institutional investors are increasingly allocating small portions of their portfolios to cryptocurrencies, recognizing their potential for outsized returns and risk mitigation benefits.
And platforms now allow easier integration of crypto into broader investment strategies.
By offering alternative exposure beyond legacy financial instruments, cryptocurrency reshapes how diversification is approached in traditional markets, encouraging both retail and institutional players to adapt new strategies.
Democratizing Access to Investment Opportunities Cryptocurrencies break down barriers to entry for investors globally, offering financial inclusion in ways traditional markets often cannot.
Unlike stocks or bonds that may require intermediaries, cryptocurrencies allow direct ownership and trading through blockchain networks.
Decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms further democratize access by providing services like lending, borrowing, and yield generation without relying on banks.
This enables individuals from underserved regions to participate in financial markets previously out of reach.
By removing geographical restrictions and reducing the need for intermediaries, cryptocurrency expands investment opportunities for retail investors worldwide while challenging the exclusivity of traditional financial systems.
Changing How Market Liquidity Functions Cryptocurrency is reshaping how liquidity operates in investment markets.
One example is BTC/USD CFD trading, which stands for Bitcoin/US Dollar Contracts for Difference. If you’re not aware, CFDs are financial derivatives that allow traders to speculate on price movements without owning the actual asset.
When investors trade BTC/USD online using CFDs, they’re essentially entering agreements to exchange the difference in Bitcoin’s value between its opening and closing prices. This type of trading boosts liquidity by attracting participants who prefer not to directly hold cryptocurrencies but still want exposure to their volatility.
By linking cryptocurrency price activity with traditional market tools like CFDs, these products help integrate crypto trends into broader financial systems while driving greater market participation.
Other examples also highlight how cryptocurrency influences market liquidity. For example:
Decentralized exchanges (DEXs) enable peer-to-peer trades without intermediaries, fostering continuous liquidity in the crypto ecosystem. Stablecoins like USDT bridge traditional currencies and digital assets, acting as a medium of exchange to smooth transactions during volatile periods. Tokenized assets – such as real estate or equities on blockchain platforms – introduce fractional ownership opportunities that attract more participants. These innovations collectively transform liquidity dynamics across both traditional and cryptocurrency markets, reinforcing their interconnected growth.
Reshaping Risk and Volatility Perceptions in Investments Cryptocurrency’s inherent volatility is altering how investors view and assess risk in financial markets.
Traditional models, which prioritize stability and predictability, often struggle to account for the dramatic price swings common with digital assets like Bitcoin and Ethereum.
This shift forces investors to rethink diversification strategies and adopt tools better suited for analyzing volatile assets. For instance, the introduction of crypto derivatives – such as futures and options – helps manage exposure while leveraging market movements.
Moreover, high volatility attracts traders seeking quick profits through short-term speculation. While this creates opportunities, it also heightens risks significantly.
Cryptocurrency’s rise has led financial professionals to revisit standard risk models entirely, adapting them to include a more dynamic approach suitable for such emerging markets.
Creating Crossroads Between Fintech and Legacy Systems Cryptocurrencies have bridged gaps between fintech innovation and traditional financial systems.
Blockchain technology (which, incidentally, has applications in sports ) enables faster, more secure transactions compared to legacy infrastructures like SWIFT or ACH transfers. This has encouraged banks and financial institutions to explore blockchain-based solutions.
Partnerships between crypto firms and traditional players are increasing. Examples include Visa incorporating stablecoin payments or major exchanges collaborating with institutional investors for custody solutions.
These interactions allow legacy markets to leverage cryptocurrency’s efficiency while maintaining compliance standards.
By blending old frameworks with emerging tech, this synergy not only enhances transaction processes but also fosters innovation across the broader investment landscape.
Final Thoughts Cryptocurrency is reshaping traditional investment markets, fostering innovation and inclusion. Its growing influence highlights a financial evolution, blending new technologies with established systems to redefine the future of investing.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->investment and opinion pieces
Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Kelly Martin
title: Merck's Clesrovimab Shows Promise in Reducing RSV in Infants
text: Merck's Clesrovimab Shows Promise in Reducing RSV in Infants [Kelly Martin](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79570)Updated: 10-17-2024 06:14 PM Positive Results from Merck's Clesrovimab Trials Merck (NYSE: MRK), recognized globally as MSD except in the U.S. and Canada, has shared promising data from its Phase 2b/3 clinical trial focusing on clesrovimab. This investigational monoclonal antibody aims to safeguard infants from respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) during their vital first RSV season. The latest findings were revealed at IDWeek 2024, showcasing the depth of research invested into this critical issue. Efficacy of Clesrovimab in Infants The Phase 2b/3 trial, labeled MK-1654-004, presented impressive outcomes, exhibiting a significant reduction in RSV incidence among healthy preterm and full-term infants up to one year of age. The trial met its key endpoints effectively, demonstrating that the single dosage of clesrovimab significantly cut down the emergence of RSV-related lower respiratory infections requiring medical intervention by 60.4%. Additionally, it reduced related hospitalizations by a staggering 84.2%, indicating its potential to greatly ease the burden of RSV on both infants and medical systems alike. Safety and Comparisons with Established Treatments Notably, the safety profile of clesrovimab was comparable to established treatments, with no serious adverse effects surfacing during the studies. This starkly contrasts with the backdrop of RSV posing extensive hospitalization threats to many infants. The data thus far reveal that both c lesrovimab and traditional treatments, such as palivizumab, exhibit favorable safety benchmarks, paving the road for more thorough evaluations in future studies. Additional Insights from the MK-1654-007 Trial In tandem with MK-1654-004, insights from the ongoing MK-1654-007 trial also further substantiate the credibility of Merck’s research. This Phase 3 study draws comparisons between clesrovimab and palivizumab among infants identified at increased risk of severe RSV. Preliminary analyses indicated similar hospitalization rates for both treatments, sparking optimism about the broader outreach clesrovimab holds. The Future and Implications of Clesrovimab As RSV continues to pose significant healthcare challenges, Merck's research on clesrovimab signifies a noteworthy advancement in protective measures for infants. With the potential of changing how we approach RSV immunization, clesrovimab may soon stand as a reliable option for health authorities aiming to combat RSV challenges head-on during the upcoming seasons. Understanding RSV and its Impact on Healthcare Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) remains a leading cause of hospitalization among infants worldwide, causing severe respiratory issues akin to pneumonia and bronchiolitis. Awareness surrounding this viral infection has become crucial, especially considering its significant contribution to morbidity rates in children under five. The call for effective preventive measures remains louder than ever, discovering options that are accessible for at-risk populations. About Merck and Its Commitment Merck, better known as MSD outside North America, boasts a rich history of leveraging scientific innovations to enhance health and save lives globally. With a commitment spanning over 130 years, Merck continuously strives to develop essential medications and vaccines that address key health concerns, heralding a robust future for research-intensive biopharmaceutical advancements. By prioritizing diversity and inclusivity within the workforce, Merck aims to operate responsibly, ensuring a healthy environment for all. Frequently Asked Questions What is clesrovimab designed for? Clesrovimab is developed as a preventive monoclonal antibody aiming to protect infants from RSV during their first RSV season. How effective was clesrovimab in trials? Trials indicated a reduction of 60.4% in RSV-associated medically attended infections, along with an 84.2% reduction in hospitalizations. What were the trial's safety outcomes? The safety profile of clesrovimab was comparable to existing treatments, showing no serious adverse events. When can we expect more data on clesrovimab? Further insights will emerge as ongoing trials continue, aimed at securing regulatory approvals and determining market readiness. Why is RSV a significant concern for infants? RSV can lead to severe illnesses, including pneumonia and bronchiolitis, contributing to high hospitalization rates among infants worldwide. author: Redacción El País
title: Autoridades vallecaucanas reforzarán operativos para garantizar seguridad durante este fin de año
text:
Valle
Autoridades vallecaucanas reforzarán operativos para garantizar seguridad durante este fin de año
Los operativos para evitar delitos como el hurto a personas, residencias y vehículos, tanto en zonas urbanas como rurales también son una prioridad en este cierre del 2024.
[Por: Redacción El País](/autor/redaccion-el-pais/)
Con el objeto de fortalecer la lucha [contra el contrabando de licores y cigarrillos](https://www.elpais.com.co/judicial/autoridades-incautaron-mas-de-100-mil-cajetillas-de-cigarrillos-de-contrabando-en-zona-urbana-de-cali-2410.html), y prevenir el uso de la pólvora, las autoridades del Valle del Cauca han reforzado los operativos en el departamento y así garantizar la seguridad de propios y visitantes durante este fin de año.
Según explicó la secretaria de Convivencia y Seguridad del departamento, Ana María Sanclemente, de este proceso participarán la Policía Nacional, el Ejército Nacional y la Gobernación del Valle.
“Tendremos operativos con el Escuadrón Antipólvora de la Policía Nacional y, por supuesto, seguiremos en labores de patrullaje por parte de los uniformados y los esquemas de seguridad en los centros poblados de los diferentes municipios del Valle del Cauca”, indicó Sanclemente.
A ello agregó que también se mantendrá un control al porte ilegal de armas de fuego. “Eso será una de las líneas estratégicas para trabajar este 31 de diciembre”, sostuvo la Secretaria de Seguridad.
Por su parte, el comandante de la Policía Valle, el general Giovanni Cristancho, indicó que hasta el momento los uniformados han logrado incautar más de 2500 botellas de licor adulterado. “Asimismo, el control de las vías donde estamos trabajando con el Ejército. Son catorce puntos de control”, manifestó el general.
Es de recordar que el pasado 18 de diciembre,[ las autoridades incautaron 6500 unidades de licor adulterado](https://www.elpais.com.co/cali/mas-de-seis-toneladas-de-licor-y-cigarrillos-de-contrabando-fueron-incautadas-y-destruidas-en-el-valle-1840.html) y 4700 cajetillas de cigarrillos de contrabando en el departamento, mercancía que estaba avaluada en más de 152 millones de pesos, según se informó desde la Unidad de Rentas del Valle.
Los operativos para evitar delitos como el hurto a personas, residencias y vehículos, tanto en zonas urbanas como rurales también son una prioridad en este cierre del 2024, según informaron las autoridades vallecaucanas.
Así las cosas, las autoridades le hicieron un llamado a los vallecaucanos para que disfruten de las fiestas de fin de año en paz y tranquilidad, y reporten cualquier delito o situación que represente una amenaza para la seguridad en la región.

author: @zazoomblog
title: Vavassori-Errani vincono il doppio misto negli Us Open ed entrano nella storia
text: Fonte : agi di 5 set 2024 Vavassori-Errani vincono il doppio misto negli Us Open ed entrano nella storia Vavassori-Errani vincono il doppio misto negli Us Open ed entrano nella storia (Di giovedÃ¬ 5 settembre 2024) AGI - Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori nella storia : sono la prima coppia tutta italiana di doppio misto a vincere gli Us Open . I due azzurri hanno la meglio in finale sulla coppia statunitense formata da Taylor Townsend e Donald Young battuta 7-6 7-5.Â Leggi tutta la notizia su agi Notizie su altre fonti Errani e Vavassori vincono il doppio misto agli US Open e fanno la storia del tennis italiano - Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori hanno vinto il torneo di doppio misto degli US Open 2024. La coppa italiana ha sconfitto in finale in due set gli americani Townsend e Young.Continua a leggere . fanpage LIVE Errani/Vavassori-Townsend/Young 7-6, 7-5, US Open 2024 in DIRETTA: storico primo titolo in doppio misto dellâ€™Italia! - Per la prima volta nella storia câ€™Ã¨ una coppia italiana a giocarsi un trofeo Major, Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori hanno saputo destreggiarsi allâ€™interno del tabellone a 32 coppie miste che hanno preso il via a New York. Di fronte câ€™Ã¨ Donald Young, tennista allâ€™ultimo torneo della carriera, che vanta come miglior risultato quel roboante ottavo di finale, proprio agli US Open e nel 2011. oasport LIVE â€“ Errani/Vavassori-Townsend/Young 7-6(0) 3-1, finale doppio misto US Open 2024: RISULTATO in DIRETTA - itÂ garantirÃ ai propri lettoriÂ aggiornamenti in tempo reale. . 12 â€“ Si parte con Donald Young al servizio 21. 01 â€“ Ãˆ la prima volta che una coppia interamente italiana arriva in una finale slam nel doppio misto 20. 00 italiane (le 15. Ora tra loro ed uno storico titolo câ€™Ã¨ unâ€™altra formazione americana, che nel penultimo atto non ha lasciato scampo al tandem formato dallâ€™indonesiana Aldila Sutjiadi e dallâ€™indiano Rohan Bopanna. sportface Us Open, Errani e Vavassori nella storia: trionfano nel doppio misto - Nella storia degli Slam c'erano finora due successi 'italiani' nel doppio misto : Nicola Pietrangeli al Roland Garros 1958 con la britannica Shirley Bloomer, e Raffaella Reggi agli Us Open 1986 con lo ... repubblica Errani eterna, vince il doppio misto agli Us Open - Con Vavassori liquida in due set gli americani Townsend e Young.
